description: From Medieval Latin disciplinarius, from Latin disciplina (“instruction, teaching, field of study, habit”).

adjectives.description: disciplinary (comparative more disciplinary, superlative most disciplinary)

entries.meaning: Having to do with discipline, or with the imposition of discipline.
examples: Debt can motivate or act as a disciplinary force for executives to achieve organizational efficiency.

entries.meaning: For the purpose of imposing punishment.
examples: The school has announced that it will take disciplinary measures against the students who participated in the protest activities.

entries.meaning: Of or relating to an academic field of study.
examples: We hope that psychologists will applaud good studies of scientific behavior and thought regardless of the disciplinary specialty of the author.
